page.title: 05Grosnez Castle
page.content:
Grosnez Castle is the name of ruins 240 feet above sea level in the north west corner of Jersey. It occupies, with all the enclosure around it the whole of the actual point of Grosnez. The perimiter wall was about 250 yards long.The Gatehouse had a portcullis and a battlemented roof.
Grosnez Castle was in ruins by 1540 and it is thought that it may have been destroyed deliberately by the De Carterets (the owners of St.Ouens manor) during the wars of the Roses,they were on the losing side (the White Rose) and so the opposing side, the Red Rose, deliberatly destroyed the Castle.
